Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the

 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.

ALLEGATION:
During a recent camping trip, a staff member poked youth in the chest and youth
swung at staff member. In response, staff member threw youth on the ground and
had their knee on youth's back. Another staff member pulled staff member off of
youth. The restraint performed was improper. On 5/31/22, youth had healing scrapes
on various body parts and previously had a bruise on the cheekbone. It is unknown if
management addressed the issue as staff continues to work with youth.
INVESTIGATION:
Interviews:
2

Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/2/2022 in collaboration
with MDHHS worker. Youth A reported while on a camping trip at Grace
Adventures he began walking away from his group due to being upset but did not
recall why he was upset. Youth A reported he was walking to the river to throw
rocks when Staff 2, who was with him, called Staff 1 on the phone. Youth A reported
Staff 1 came over the bridge towards where he was with Staff 2. Staff 1 told Youth A
to get his butt back to camp or staff would go hands on. Youth A reported Staff 1
approached him and placed his hand straight out with his palm open and was
pushing his fingertips into Youth A’s chest. Youth A reported he did not know why
Staff 1 did this. Youth A reported he told Staff 1 that he did not want to do this
referring to something bad happening such as a restraint and that he would go back
to the camp. Staff 1 continued pushing into his chest with his fingers for 1-2 minutes.
Youth A reported he blacked out and swung a punch at Staff 1. Staff 1 took him to
the ground by using both hands and pushing Youth A to the ground. Youth A
reported he landed on his back and butt. Youth A was unable to recall how Staff 1
landed. Youth A reported Staff 1 was wrestling on the ground with him where there
were a lot of tiny twigs. Youth A reported Staff 1 attempted to get him into a restraint
but was not able to. Youth A reported while Staff 1 was wresting him on the ground,
Staff 1 put his balled fist on Youth A’s left cheek. Youth A indicated he then spit at
Staff 1. Youth A reported it hurt when Staff 1 had his fist on his cheek and that he
was telling Staff 1 that it hurt. Youth A reported Staff 3 and Staff 4 came and were
able to place him in a proper restraint. Youth A reported Staff 1 released him and 1-2
minutes later Staff 3 and Staff 4 performed a proper restraint. Youth A did not recall
Staff 3 or Staff 4 saying anything to him or Staff 1 prior to placing him in a restraint.
Youth A described the restraint by Staff 3 and Staff 4 as he was sitting on the ground
on his butt. Youth A reported Staff 3 was talking to him while Staff 4 had his arms in
the restraint. Youth A reported he did not know why Staff 3 or Staff 4 put him in a
restraint as Youth A said he was not fighting. Youth A reported he did not recall any
other conversation. Youth A reported he started to calm down and was released
from the restraint and walked back to camp and went to bed. Youth A reported he
had scrapes on his right knee, hand and elbow from the incident. Youth A reported
he did not receive any treatment for his injuries from the restraint while camping.
Youth A reported he was bleeding and someone who he could not recall gave in
paper towel. Youth A reported his right hand was scrapped up, his right elbow and
his right knee. Youth A reported Staff 1 performs restraints too rough to the point he
knows he is hurting him. Youth A reported Staff 1 restrained him 2 years ago and he
did not do it as hard due to Youth A indicating he was younger then.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/2/2022 in collaboration
with MDHHS worker. Staff 2 reported he was working with Youth A while at Grace
Adventures on the camping trip. Staff 2 reported Youth A became upset on
5/19/2022 when Staff 2 told him he could not have a s’more as it was a reward for
good behavior. Staff 2 reported Youth A walked off towards the bridge that connects
to the island where they were camping. Staff 2 began following Youth A and was
able to get in front of Youth A on the bridge and began using proximity control by
3

standing in front of Youth A to prevent him from going across the bridge to try to get
Youth A to go back to the camp. Staff 2 reported Youth A pushed past him and
continued over to bridge and went to the facility van that was parked. Staff 2
reported Youth A began yanking on the van doors trying to open them. Staff 2
reported he called Staff 1 on his cell phone and requested backup. Staff 2 reported
Youth A began yelling at him and calling him names. Staff 2 reported Youth A
began walking to the water on the side of the bridge. Staff 2 reported he got within 5
feet of Youth A and moved to position himself so Youth A could not continue any
farther. Youth A continued to yell at Staff 2 and told Staff 2 not to touch him. Staff 2
reported he was trying to calm Youth A down by exploring why he was upset. Staff
2 reported he then sat in silence with Youth A. Staff 2 reported Youth A told him that
he was not going back to camp. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 arrived and stood on the
bridge observing the situation for about 2-3 minutes. Staff 1 gave Youth A two
options, walk back to camp on his own or staff were going to escort him back. Staff
2 reported Youth A continued yelling and Staff 1 walked toward Youth A. Staff 1
stopped 10-15 feet way from Youth A and Staff 2 reported he began walking closer
to Youth A with his hand out toward him. Staff 2 reported Youth A began yelling at
him in the face at which time Staff 1 moved in closer and Youth A then began yelling
in Staff 1’s face. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was 3-5 feet away from Youth A and Youth
A swung to punch Staff 1. Staff 2 reported he nor Staff 1 had touch Youth A. Staff 1
deflected the punch by stepping to the side and guiding Youth A’s arm with one
hand and shoulder with his other hand. Staff 2 reported Youth A did not make
contact in hitting Staff 1. Youth A then slipped as they were standing on the
riverside where it was muddy. Staff 2 reported Youth A attempted to get up and
swung to hit Staff 2 again and fell back into the mud. Staff 2 reported Youth A was
falling in the mud and there were a lot of small twigs on the ground. Staff 2 reported
Staff 1 attempted to place Youth A in an Aegis hold however was unable to get into
the position. Staff 2 reported Youth A was laying on his back facing up with Staff 1’s
knees to the side of Youth A’s body and Staff 1 was leaning over Youth A’s chest
and face area to hold his arms straight out to his side. Staff 2 reported Youth A was
kicking at which time Staff 2 bridged his legs. Staff 2 reported he and Staff 1
attempted several times to get Youth A into the Aegis hold and were unable to. Staff
2 reported Staff 1 was attempted to hook Youth A’s arms by securing Youth A’s
arms behind his back to restrict movement to get into the hold however Youth A was
wiggling in the mud and when Staff 1 would attempt to let go, Youth A would attempt
to hit him. Staff 2 reported being in this position for about 2 minutes when Youth A
spit at Staff 1’s face. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 used his right hand, palm open, and
placed it on the side of Youth A’s face to turn Youth A’s face away from Staff 1 to
prevent spitting. Staff 2 reported Youth A said “ow” when Staff 1 his leg over Youth
A’s arm to secure it down. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was not using too much pressure
while doing this. Staff 2 reported the whole incident lasted 8-10 minutes, 4-5
minutes which were with Staff 1’s leg holding Youth A’s arm down. Staff 2 reported
in the 8-10 minutes he and Staff 1 were not able to get Youth A into an Aegis hold.
Staff 2 reported he is trained in Aegis and that the training model states if staff are
unable to get a youth into the proper hold to back away and re-engage. Staff 2
reported this did not occur. Staff 2 reported he felt that due to Youth A trying to
4

assault staff that he and Staff 1 needed to keep Youth A held for safety for
themselves, Youth A, and nearby campers. Staff 2 reported Youth A was not able to
be put into an Aegis hold until Staff 3 arrived. Staff 2 reported when Staff 3 arrived
Staff 1 lifted Youth A up off the ground and Staff 3 was able to transition into a
seated Aegis safety position. Staff 2 reported he went back to the camp to switch
out Staff 4 so he could go to assist with Youth A. Staff 2 reported Youth A had a
small cut on his shoulder from the twigs on the ground. Youth A was wearing a thin
white tank top that had torn during the attempted restraint and fell off Youth A. Staff
2 reported Youth A’s tank top was not grabbed by staff. Staff 2 reported Youth A did
not have any other injuries that he was aware of. Staff 2 was shown pictures of the
injuries that Youth A had on his right knee, hand, and elbow. Staff 2 reported the
injuries were not consistent with the type of ground they were on as it looked like
injuries from gravel. Staff 2 reported Youth A was never on the ground near gravel
during the restraint. Staff 2 reported he arrived back at the camp to switch out Staff
4 around 9:05pm and that Youth A, Staff 1, Staff 3, and Staff 4 returned around 9:30.
Staff 2 was unaware of what occurred with Youth A after he returned to camp. Staff
2 reported based on his training he felt Staff 1 handled the situation well.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/2/2022 in collaboration
with MDHHS worker. Staff 3 reported he was on the island where the camp was
located, and he heard that someone had ran and could hear yelling. Staff 3 reported
he ran across the bridge and saw Staff 1, Staff 2, and Youth A. Youth A was laying
on his back on the ground on a slope going down to the river and was attempting to
punch Staff 1. Staff 3 reported Youth A was laying on his back with his arms out to
the side and Staff 1 was over Youth A holding his arms. Staff 3 reported he thought
this was an odd position. Staff 3 reported he instructed Staff 1 and Staff 2 to let
Youth A up at which time Staff 1 and Staff 2 let loose of their hold on Youth A. Staff
3 told Staff 1 and Staff 2 to let Youth A go due to Youth A being on his back and
Staff 3 wanting to get Youth A in a proper Aegis hold. Staff 3 reported Youth A
began swinging his arms at him. Staff 3 placed Youth A in a one person seated
Aegis safety position. Staff 3 reported Youth A continued yelling at Staff 1. Staff 3
reported Youth A was escalated with just Staff 1 and did not resist the restraint with
Staff 3. Staff 3 reported he called Staff 4 on the radio to come assist due to concern
that he would not be able to hold Youth A long in the restraint due to his back issues.
Staff 3 reported Staff 4 also has a good relationship with Youth A. Staff 3 reported
Staff 4 arrived and was able to switch him out of the restraint. Staff 3 reported Youth
A continued to be fixated on Staff 1. Staff 3 reported Youth A was stating Staff 1
punched him in the face twice. Staff 3 reported once Staff 4 switched him out in the
restraint that he and Staff 1 stepped back to allow Staff 4 to de-escalate Youth A.
Staff 3 reported Staff 1 told him that he never punched Youth A in the face. Staff 3
reported Staff 4 was able to de-escalate Youth A and Staff 4 walked back to the
camp with Youth A. Staff 3 reported Youth A did not have any injuries on his face.
Staff 3 reported following the restraint he did a head-to-toe check on Youth A for
injuries and did not see any. Staff 3 reported he asked Youth A if he was having any
pain and Youth A reported he did not. Staff 3 reported the area where the restraint
occurred was on wet/moist ground. Staff 3 was shown pictures of Youth A’s injuries
5

on his right hand, elbow and knee. Staff 3 reported Youth A was covered in mud
and grass and that he did not recall seeing any injuries. Staff 3 reported Staff 4 was
the primary medical on staff during the camping trip and may have been aware of
the injuries.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/2/2022 in collaboration
with MDHHS worker. Staff 4 reported he was aware Youth A left the camping area
and that staff were with him. Staff 4 stayed back at the camp with other youth. Staff
4 reported Staff 2 came back to the camp and requested he go assist Staff 1 and
Staff 3. Upon arriving Staff 3 had Youth A in a one person seated Aegis safety
position. Staff 3 asked Staff 4 to switch him out of the restraint. Staff 4 reported he
transitioned Staff 3 out and Staff 4 maintained the one person seated Aegis safety
position. Staff 4 reported Youth A was yelling and was escalated stating Staff 1 had
punched him in the face. Staff 4 reported he was able to get Youth A calmed down
and made a plan to release Youth A from the restraint. Staff 4 reported he released
Youth A and walked back to the camp one on one with him. Staff 4 reported he did
not see any abrasions or bruises on Youth A. Staff 4 reported Youth A was covered
in mud. Staff 4 was shown the pictures of Youth A’s right elbow, hand and knee and
reported he did not see any of these injuries on Youth A. Staff 4 reported if Youth A
would have needed any medical attention that Youth A would have gone to him, and
he did not. Staff 4 reported Youth A never reported any injuries to him. Staff 4
reported he did not follow up with Youth A regarding his statements about Staff 1
punching him in the face. Staff 4 reported he debriefed with Staff 1 and Staff 1
informed him that he was attempting to keep himself and other’s safe from Youth A’s
behaviors. Staff 4 reported Staff 1 told him that Youth A spit on him.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/2/2022 in collaboration
with MDHHS worker. Staff 1 reported he was working with a different group and
was contacted by Staff 2 for assistance with Youth A due to Youth A leaving the
island. Staff 1 reported he notified Staff 3 and Grace Adventure Administration due
to Youth A being towards other campers that were not from the facility. Staff 1
reported he was crossing the bridge when he saw Youth A at the other side of the
bridge down by the water talking to Staff 2. Staff 1 reported he stood and observed
Staff 2 with Youth A for a few minutes. Staff 1 reported he then told Youth A that he
had choices, Youth A could talk to Staff 4, Youth A could talk to Staff 3, Youth A
could come back to the camp or Youth A could go fishing. Staff 1 denied giving
Youth A only two options of going back to the camp on his own or staff going hands
on. Staff 1 reported Youth A refused to follow one of the choices. Staff 1 reported
he went towards Staff 2 and was approximately 5 yards from Youth A. Youth A
began making threats to Staff 1 stating if he came any closer that he would hit him.
Staff 1 reported Youth A had his fist raised to him. Staff 1 reported he was two arm
lengths from Youth A, Youth A swung to punch him, and he side stepped to avoid
the punch and Youth A fell to the ground. Youth A got up and attempted to swing at
him again and fell back down. Staff 1 denied picking Youth A up and throwing him
on the ground. Staff 1 denied picking Youth A up at any time. Staff 1 reported he
attempted to put Youth A in an Aegis safety position and Staff 2 assisted with
6

bridging Youth A’s legs due to Youth A kicking. Staff 1 reported he attempted 2-3
times to transition into the hold while Youth A was pulling his hand away and trying
to bite him. Staff 1 reported Youth A then began spitting. Staff 1 reported Youth A
was laying on the ground on his back and he was holding Youth A’s arms out to the
side. Staff 1 reported when Youth A began spitting at him, Staff 1 placed his thumb
on Youth A’s chin to transition his face away from Staff 1 while he repositioned his
body to be vertical to avoid the spitting. Staff 1 reported he maintained his hands on
Youth A’s wrist during this time. Staff 1 denied using his leg to hold down Youth A’s
arm. Staff 1 reported he attempted to get Youth A into the Aegis safety position 3-4
times during the 10 minutes. Staff 1 reported he called Staff 3 over his Apple watch
for assistance. Staff 1 reported Staff 3 arrived and switched into a one person
seated Aegis safety position with Youth A. Staff 1 reported he sent Staff 2 back to
the camp to get Staff 4. Staff 1 reported Youth A was claiming he was being abused
and yelling. Staff 1 reported Staff 4 came and transitioned Staff 3 out of the one
person seated Aegis safety position. Staff 1 reported Staff 4 processed with Youth A
and was able to come up with a safety plan. Staff 1 reported Youth A went back to
camp with Staff 4. Staff 1 reported Staff 3 checked Youth A for injuries and there
were no injuries. Staff 1 denied Youth A being prone at any time and denied having
his knee on Youth A’s back. Staff 1 reported he never noticed Youth A to have any
injuries and reported he never saw Youth A have any blood on him. Staff 1 reported
Youth A never stated he was in any pain. Staff 1 reported Youth A yelled that Staff 1
was assaulting him and for someone to call police. Staff 1 reported Youth A
continued to yell the same statements when Staff 3 had him in the one person
seated Aegis safety position. Staff 1 reported he is trained in Aegis. Staff 1 reported
the Aegis model states that if you are unable to get youth into the proper hold to let
go and re-engage. Staff 1 reported he did not let go. Staff 1 reported he tried to
transition 2-3 times to get Youth A into a proper Aegis hold but was unable. Staff 1
reported he did not let go due to Youth A continuing to try to hit him. Staff 1 reported
he did not disengage from the attempted restraint due to it only being him and a new
staff as well as he was not comfortable due to Youth A being out of bounds and the
location.
Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D were interviewed face-to-face on 6/13/2022 via
Teams meeting separately in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B,
Youth C, and Youth D all reported they were aware that Youth A left the camping
area the last night of the camping trip at Grace Adventures. Youth B, Youth C, and
Youth D did not see what occurred with Youth A however all reported hearing Youth
A yelling and screaming however could not make out anything he was specifically
yelling. Youth B reported he was staying in the same cabin as Youth A. Youth B
reported when Youth A came back to the cabin he was dirty and he did not notice
any injuries on Youth A. Youth C and Youth D reported they saw Youth A the next
day and they did not see any injuries on Youth A. Youth B and Youth C reported
they have seen Staff 1 perform restraints and they do not have any concerns with
Staff 1. Youth D reported he has been restrained by Staff 1 and feels that Staff 1
gets away with doing inappropriate things (This is being investigated in Special
Investigation 2022C0116032).
7

MDHHS worker has no findings in this investigation.
Documents Reviewed:
 Eagle Village Incident Report dated 5/19/2022 states Youth A was not following
staff directives to return to camp and was making threats to hit staff. Youth A
attempted to punch Staff 1 twice at which time Staff 1 attempted to put Youth A in
an Aegis safety position and was unable due to Youth A continuing to attempt to
hit staff. Youth A was on the ground on his back where Staff 1 stabilized his
arms and Staff 2 bridged his legs. Youth A was attempting to spit and headbutt
and Staff 1 repositioned Youth A’s head by guiding the youth’s chin to the other
direction until Staff 3 arrived and was able to put Youth in into a Benevolent
restraint and quickly transitioned into an Aegis safety position. Staff 4 assisted
and transitioned Staff 3 out and continued to have Youth A in an Aegis safety
position until a safety plan was formulated with Youth A.
 Eagle Village Residential Services Standard Operating Procedures Therapeutic
Holds.
 Staff 1’s personnel file: There is a discipline record from March 9, 2021, for an
unwarranted restraint. Staff 1 worked with supervision and Residential
Leadership on verbal de-escalation technique. Staff 1 has the required Aegis
Training hours.
 Staff 2’s personnel file: There was no discipline record and Staff 2 has required
Aegis Training hours.
 Staff 3’s personnel file: There was no discipline record related to restraints and
Staff 3 has required Aegis Training hours.
 Staff 4’s personnel file: There was no discipline record and Staff 4 has required
Aegis Training hours.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4159 Resident Restraint.
(2) Resident restraint shall be performed in a manner that is
safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity of the
minor child’s behavior, chronological and developmental
age, size, gender, physical condition, medical condition,
psychiatric condition, and personal history, including any
history of trauma, and done in a manner consistent with the
resident’s treatment plan.
8

ANALYSIS: Youth A was placed in a hold that is not an approved hold per
the Aegis model as he was laying on his back with Staff 1
positioned over his body holding his wrist while Staff 2 bridged
his legs. Staff 1 and Staff 2 both reported being trained in the
Aegis model and stated the Aegis model states that if staff
unable to get a youth in a proper Aegis hold, to let go and re-
engage. Staff 1 and Staff 2 both reported they did not let go of
Youth A to re-engage to get into a proper Aegis hold.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ALLEGATION:
Youth was pushed to the ground by staff during a restraint on 6/1/2022.
INVESTIGATION:
Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/2/2022 in collaboration
with MDHHS worker. Youth A reported Staff 1 restrained him again yesterday.
Youth A reported he was cussing and upset that the line had to be reset due to
youth not listening. Youth A reported he began to walk away stating he was going to
talk to an Administrator. Youth A reported Staff 1 heard him and got in his face and
began screaming at him. Youth A was unable to recall anything specific Staff 1 was
screaming at him. Youth A reported he started to run and Staff 1 said “were doing
this”. Youth A reported he stopped running and Staff 1 came up behind him and
grabbed him by the shirt and pushed him to the ground. Youth A reported he
thought it was Staff 1 who pushed him to the ground. Youth A reported Staff 5 and
Staff 6 attempted to put him into a restraint on the ground but that he would not let
them. Youth A was then asked if Staff 1 restrained him and he stated Staff 1 did not
restrain him on 6/1/2022. Youth A stated Staff 1 pushed him. Youth A reported his
shoulder was sore and that he saw the nurse this morning. Youth A reported his
shoulder was sore from that restraint as Staff 5 and Staff 6 had his arms touching
behind his back while in the restraint. Youth A reported he told Staff 5 and Staff 6
that it hurt and they continued holding him in the position. Youth A reported he tried
to drop to the ground while in the restraint and Staff 1 grabbed his feet. Youth A
reported he did not recall anything after that. Youth A reported he asked to talk to
Administration after the restraint and was told no and he could write a grievance if he
wanted to. Youth A reported he wrote a grievance and turned it into his therapist on
6/1/2022.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/2/2022 in collaboration
with MDHHS worker. Staff 1 reported Youth A became escalated on 6/1/2022.
Staff 1 reported Youth A was verbally aggressive after getting upset with his peers
during line up time. Staff 1 reported Youth A began walking away from the house
and then began running. Staff 1 reported Staff 5 and Staff 6 were able to catch up
with Youth A and began using proximity control by placing themselves within arms
9

distance of Youth A to keep Youth A from running. Staff 1 reported he was present
and was assisting to coach Staff 5 and Staff 6. Staff 1 reported he and Staff 5 and
Staff 6 were giving Youth A space and options. Youth A was saying he wanted to
get staff fired. Staff 1 reported Youth A started to run down the trail and Staff 6 was
standing in front of the trail. Staff 1 reported he and Staff 5 followed Youth A. Staff
1 reported Youth A attempted to punch Staff 5, Staff 5 initiated an Aegis benevolent
restraint and Staff 1 and Staff 6 transitioned Youth A to an Aegis safety position.
Staff 1 reported he had Youth A’s left arm, Staff 6 had the right arm, and Staff 5
bridged Youth A’s feet. Staff 1 reported he and Staff 6 transitioned Youth A into a
standing Level 1 Aegis hold due to Youth A kicking Staff 5 in the face. Staff 1
reported he instructed Staff 6 to release as well as he did as Staff 1 indicated due to
Youth A resisting, he wanted staff and himself to disengage. Staff 1 reported Youth
A was still escalated. Staff 1 reported he, Staff 5 and Staff 6 positioned themselves
in a triangle around Youth A to give him space. Staff 1 reported Youth A sat down
and began crying stating staff were abusing him and was calling staff racial slurs.
Staff 1 denied ever pushing Youth A or grabbing his shirt. Staff 1 denied any staff
pushing Youth A or grabbing his shirt. Staff 1 reported Youth A did not have any
injuries. Staff 1 reported disengaging from this restraint as he felt more comfortable
with having 3 experienced staff present.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face by Teams meeting on 6/8/2022 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 5 reported he saw Youth A walking down
the trail swearing at staff. Staff 5 reported Youth A was escalated as he was
frustrated with a peer. Staff 5 reported he went down to Youth A and attempted to
de-escalate Youth A and get him to go into the house to do the afternoon routine
and Youth A refused. Staff 5 reported Youth A continued going toward the trail at
which time he and Staff 1 followed using proximity control by remaining within arms
distance of Youth A to keep Youth A from running. Staff 5 reported Youth A began
running and fell to the ground. Youth A continued to get up and start walking and
then turned around and attempted to punch Staff 5. Staff 5 reported he initiated an
Aegis benevolent restraint. Staff 5 reported Staff 1 had him transition into a one-on-
one hold due to the one-on-one hold being less restrictive and there were additional
staff there to assist. Staff 5 reported Youth A began to slip out of the benevolent
hold and Staff 6 transitioned to Youth A’s left arm and Staff 1 had Youth A’s right
arm. Staff 5 reported he transitioned to Youth A’s legs as Youth A was kicking.
Staff 5 reported Youth A began to turn to his stomach at which time Staff 1, Staff 5
and Staff 6 disengaged from the restraint as Staff 5 reported they are not able to
restrain prone. Staff 5 reported he was kicked in the head by Youth A during the
restraint. Staff 5 reported Youth A was de-escalated at this time and staff continued
to use proximity control by creating a triangle with the three staff around Youth A to
keep Youth A from running until Youth A was able to return to the house. Staff 5
reported Youth A was never pushed to the ground by any staff and that he felt Youth
A tripped while he was running. Staff 5 reported Youth A was saying someone
pushed him to the ground during the restraint. Staff 5 reported he thought Youth A
was talking about a different restraint. Staff 5 reported no staff grabbed Youth A’s
shirt. Staff 5 reported there were no other youth around that witnessed the restraint
10

as the other youth were in the house. Staff 5 reported this was the first restraint he
has been involved in with Staff 1.
Staff 6 was interviewed face-to-face by Teams meeting on 6/8/2022 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 6 reported Youth A became frustrated
when his group did not line up correctly and had to redo the line. Youth A was in the
back of the line with Staff 5. Youth A began shooting hoops to help calm down.
Youth A’s basketball got stuck in the hoop causing Youth A to become more
frustrated. Youth A began walking towards to trail. Staff 6 reported Staff 1 came out
